Detailed Description

This is the sample OS Adaptation layer which is used by the GPIO driver. The OSAL layer can be ported in either of the following manners to a native OS:

Approach 1:
Use Prebuilt Libraries

  • Ensure that the provide an implementation of all Osal_XXX API for their native OS.
  • Link the prebuilt libraries with their application.
  • Refer to the "example" directory for an example of this
    Pros:
  • Customers can reuse prebuilt TI provided libraries
    Cons:
  • Level of indirection in the API to get to the actual OS call

Approach 2:
Rebuilt Library

  • Create a copy of this file and modify it to directly inline the native OS calls
  • Rebuild the GPIO Driver library; ensure that the Include path points to the directory where the copy of this file has been provided.
  • Please refer to the "test" directory for an example of this
    Pros:
  • Optimizations can be done to remove the level of indirection
    Cons:
  • GPIO Libraries need to be rebuilt by the customer.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define GPIO_osalAssert (   expr)    OSAL_Assert(expr)

Assert API. If expression is true then it will stay in the while loop.

Parameters
exprExpression which need to be evaluated.
#define GPIO_osalCreateBlockingLock (   count,
  params 
)    (SemaphoreP_create((count),(params)))

The macro is used by the GPIO driver to create a semaphore for each GPIO opened in blocking mode. Semaphores created should initially be created with a count of 0 i.e. unavailable.

Parameters
countInitial count of the semaphore. For binary semaphores, only values of 0 or 1 are valid.
paramsPointer to the instance configuration parameters. NULL denotes to use the default parameters (SemOSAL default parameters as noted in SemOSAL_Params.
Returns
A void* on success or a NULL on an error
#define GPIO_osalDeleteBlockingLock (   X)    (SemaphoreP_delete(X))

The macro is used by the GPIO driver to delete a previously created semaphore. This is called when a GPIO opened in blocking mode is being closed.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    void SemOSAL_delete(void* semHandle)

Parameter
Semaphore Handle returned by the create semaphore

Return Value
Not Applicable

#define GPIO_osalHardwareIntDestruct (   X,
  Y 
)    (Osal_DeleteInterrupt((X),(Y)))

Function to deregister a interrupt.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    int HwiOSAL_deregisterInterrupt(void* hwiPtr)

Parameter
Interrupt handler

Return Value
status of operation

#define GPIO_osalHardwareIntDisable ( )    (HwiP_disable())

Function to disable interrupts to enter a critical region.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    void HwiOSAL_enterCritical()

Parameter
Not Applicable

Return Value
Interrupt key

Parameter
Pointer to the instance configuration output parameters.

#define GPIO_osalPendLock (   X,
  Y 
)    (SemaphoreP_pend((X),(Y)))

The macro is used by the GPIO driver to pend on a semaphore This is called when an application tries to receive data on a blocking when there is no data available. Since all semaphores are initially created to be unavailable; this will cause the application to block.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    void SemOSAL_pend(void* semHandle)

Parameter
Semaphore Handle

Return Value
Not Applicable

#define GPIO_osalPostLock (   X)    (SemaphoreP_post(X))

The macro is used by the GPIO driver to post the semaphore The driver posts the semaphore once data is received on a specific.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    void SemOSAL_post(void* semHandle)

Parameter
Semaphore Handle

Return Value
Not Applicable

#define GPIO_osalRegisterInterrupt (   X,
  Y 
)    (Osal_RegisterInterrupt((X),(Y)))

Function to register an interrupt.

Prototype: The following is the C prototype for the expected OSAL API.

    int OSAL_registerInterrupt(X,Y)

Parameter
Interrupt number

Parameter
eventID

Parameter
entry entry function of the hardware interrupt

Parameter
arg argument passed into the entry function

Parameter
priority

Return Value
Interrupt handler

#define GPIO_osalSemParamsInit (   params)    (SemaphoreP_Params_init(params))

Initialize params structure to default values.

The default parameters are:

  • mode: SemOSAL_Mode_COUNTING
  • name: NULL
Parameters
paramsPointer to the instance configuration parameters.
